# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = findall("# Question\n([^\n]*)", md)
    answers = findall("# Answer\n([^\n]*)", md)
    
    if length(questions) == 0 || length(answers) == 0
        return nothing
    end
    
    question_texts = [strip(md[q[1] + 8:findnext("\n", md, q[1] + 8)]) for q in questions]
    answer_texts = [strip(md[a[1] + 8:findnext("\n", md, a[1] + 8)]) for a in answers]
    
    return tuple(question_texts[i] => answer_texts[i] for i in eachindex(questions))
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to find all sections starting with `# Question` and `# Answer` within the provided markdown text. It then strips any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted texts and returns a tuple of questions and answers. If no matching sections are found, it returns `nothing`.
